title: Think knitwear means shapeless? Our fashion expert shows you how to look stylish this autumn
text:
There’s a nip in the air, the nights are drawing in and soon the clocks will be going back – yes, it’s unmistakably autumn.

But while we might miss the lighter nights and (very slightly!) warmer temperatures, there is some good news: it’s time to break out the knitwear.

This is truly a season to look forward to, with cosy jumpers and warm wools in gorgeous colours that not only keep you toasty but looking stylish too.

As the nights draw in, we can all use the change in weather to look at our Autumnal style

Here, top fashion stylist Lucas Armitage talks us through the latest trends and gives his pick of JD Williams’ current autumn range:

He says: 'September is a key time in fashion: everyone is editing their wardrobe, taking stock of what they have and adding key pieces. It’s a time of reinvention.

'It’s also a time to work out how to transition from summer into autumn and winter. What I’m seeing is a lot of layering - try wearing a roll neck sweater under the shirt dress you wore on your holiday and with a chunky boot.

JD Williams’ Cosy Edge To Edge Coatigan (£45) is perfect with a satin dress or over jeans

A big trend this year is the long-line cardigan which is a great alternative to a coat in autumn. They’re being worn slightly off-the-shoulder over dresses or, if they’re high on the neck, wrapped around and belted with nothing underneath.

Evoking high fashion vibes for me is JD Williams’ Cosy Edge To Edge Coatigan (£45) with its very current check. Wear it over a satin spot print dress with a little ankle boot when you’re going out – that clash will give it a fashion feel. Alternatively, it will look equally great over a t-shirt, jeans and a nice boot for the supermarket or day-to-day.

Another big trend is embellished trims. Buttons are becoming a feature rather than just a function and a lot off top designers are doing oversized cardigans with intricate detailing on the pockets and neckline.

Because of this the Button Split Neck Tunic (£18) is very on trend. It’s an easy-to-wear play on the standard chunky roll neck with an elongated shoulder giving it an 80s vibe which has also been seen on the catwalks recently.

JD Williams Button Split Neck Tunic (£18) comes in a range of colours, including black, left and burnt orange, right, and is an easy-to-wear play on the standard chunky roll neck

It’s got good colour options – black, burnt orange and ivory. You always see a lot of black knitwear but burnt orange and shades of red are very strong this season.

I’d style this tunic with leather leggings or wear it oversized as a dress with boots or with 10-denier tights and a high court shoe. Layer necklaces over it and have some fun.

I think in previous seasons we’ve thought of knitwear as strictly daytime but now it’s something we’re seeing more of in the evening and people are being more innovative about where they wear it and when.

Hitting both this year’s red and 80s trends is the Cosy Red Multi-Print Boyfriend Jumper (£34)

This button tunic jumper is just the kind of very adaptable piece you can do that with.

Also hitting both this year’s red and 80s trends is the Cosy Red Multi-Print Boyfriend Jumper (£34). If you want to get autumn/winter trendy, this is the one for you.

Translate it to an early evening drinks look with a slick of red lipstick and it commands attention. Layer it over a fitted black pencil skirt and red court shoe and it will look cool. Or wrap a belt around it for cocktail hour – one with an embellished buckle would be fun.

Don’t worry about looking too ‘busy’ as we’ve seen a lot of busy-ness on the catwalk. We’re seeing prints with layered necklaces, embellished belts and brooches – it’s about putting embellishment on pattern and it’s an exciting thing to do, giving your look an edge.

This JD Williams mustard yellow Cosy High Neck Jumper (£28) is right on trend this season

If you want a piece you can thrown on over anything and that you don’t have to think about, there’s the Cosy High Neck Ribbed Detail Jumper (£35)

JD Williams have really got the colours of this season right. Their mustard yellow Cosy High Neck Jumper (£28) is nice and vibrant with a texture to it I really like and a slightly-dropped shoulder for a relaxed 80s feel. You just know it’s going to be cosy.

And because it’s not too chunky, it’s a great piece for layering. Try a nice coat over the top or I’d love to see it work with a skirt. People will have pleated skirts from summer and you can carry it through to autumn with a knit like this.

Finally if you want a piece you can thrown on over anything and that you don’t have to think about, there’s the Cosy High Neck Ribbed Detail Jumper (£35). I really like this and think it would probably be the most versatile piece of knitwear you could own.

It would work well over black or blue denim, you could style it over a dress – that would be a cool 2019 way of wearing it – and if you don’t feel like that, over jeans and a chunky boot.

It’s a box ticker – if you’re having a day where you don’t feel great about your figure, it will cover you up and not cling while giving you the catwalk vibe of nonchalant, oversized knitwear in an easy-to-wear way.
description: Autumn is truly a season to look forward to, with cosy jumpers and warm wools in gorgeous colours that not only keep you toasty but looking stylish too.
